modules.description: Render a button's visual representation based on its state and a given size, returning a string depiction. Works with a record type containing button properties like label, state, and dimensions. Used to generate terminal-based UI elements for interactive applications.

Provides a render function that takes a configuration object and a template string, returning a processed string with embedded values. Works with a record type containing configuration parameters. Used to generate dynamic HTML snippets by substituting placeholders with runtime values.

Converts a value to and from JSON, handling deserialization errors. Works with a record type containing fields for action name, parameters, and execution status. Used to serialize user-triggered events for logging and deserialize commands from external configurations.

Handles server initialization with a hostname, port, and callback functions for frame generation, action processing, and string transformation. Operates on network addresses, ports, and custom frame and action types. Used to build real-time interactive services requiring event-driven response handling.
Removes special characters and normalizes whitespace from input strings. Processes raw text to ensure consistency in formatting. Used to prepare user input for safe processing in data entry systems.

Provides functions for constructing and validating Farcaster Frame payloads, including parsing user inputs and generating response structures. Works with custom data types such as frame requests, action responses, and form inputs. Used to create interactive web3 user interfaces that respond to user actions within the Farcaster ecosystem.

Generates terminal and HTML UI elements, processes configuration templates, serializes events, manages server connections, and cleans input text. Operates on records representing buttons, configurations, events, network settings, and raw strings, enabling dynamic content generation, event handling, and data normalization. Renders styled buttons, substitutes placeholders in templates, converts event data to JSON, initializes web servers with custom logic, and sanitizes user input. Examples include creating interactive command-line interfaces, generating HTML forms, logging user actions, building real-time web services, and preparing text for database entry.
